p:
The infectivity of SARS CoV‐2, relative to CoV‐1, is likely accounted for by relatively high rates of asymptomatic carriers which promote the spread of infection to susceptible populations,
13 rather than greater stability of virus in aerosolized droplets or on surfaces.
14 Despite variations and limitations in testing, CoV‐2 appears to be less virulent than CoV‐1.
15
